title: Hilarious moment a Georgia reporter has her wig SNATCHED OFF by a handsy lemur on live TV off
text:
The moment a Georgia reporter had her wig pulled of by a handsy lemur was captured on live TV.

WALB Chief Meteorologist Yolanda Amadeo wasn't expecting to have viewers in Southwest Georgia capture her hilarious hair malfunction while reporting on Thursday at the Georgia National Fair in Perry.

Amadeo was interviewing a representative from Eudora Farms Petting Zoo, according to WSRZ.

Scroll down for video

Yolanda Amadeo (pictured), the Chief Meteorologist at WALB, had a hilarious hair malfunction at the hands of a naughty lemur on Thursday

In the video, the man was holding one of the zoo's ring-tailed lemurs who quickly decides it wants to cuddle onto Amadeo's shoulder.

Amadeo seamlessly continues her interview, all the while the lemur is curiously exploring her hair.

In an unexpected twist, the lemur drags Amadeo's wig off in a fell swoop and then innocently jumps back to the man.

Amadeo (pictured) was interviewing a representative from the Eudora Farms Petting Zoo at the Georgia National Fair when the lemur decided to perch on her shoulder

Amadeo (pictured) flawlessly continues to interview the man while the lemur plays with her hair

With her braids exposed and her arm tangled in the animal's leash, Amadeo tries to fix her wig, but the lemur isn't done yet.

The feisty primate decides to take another swipe at her hair and jumps onto her back.

Amadeo runs off camera to try and escape.

The man can only smile as the lemur settles onto his back and hides behind his head.

The lemur suddenly yanks Amadeo's wig off (pictured) while the cameras are still rolling
description: WALB Chief meteorologist Yolanda Amadeo wasn't expecting to have her wig snatched off by a handsy lemur while conducting an interview with a man from the Eudora Farms Petting Zoo in Perry, Georgia
